t: Hebrews 3
Jesus Our High Priest
Therefore,*p holy brethren, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider Jesus, the Apostle and High Priest of our confession;
He was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses also was in all His house.
For He has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, by just so much as the builder of the house has more honor than the house.
For every house is built by someone, but the builder of all things is God.
Now Moses was faithful in all His house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken later;
but Christ was*i faithful*i as a Son over His house—whose house we are, if we hold fast our confidence and the boast of our hope firm until the end.
Therefore,*p just as the Holy Spirit says, “Today*spn if*s you*s hear*s His*s voice,*s
Do*sln not*s harden*s your*s hearts*s as*s when*s they*s provoked*s Me,*s As*ln in*s the*s day*s of*s trial*s in*s the*s wilderness,*s
Where*sln your*s fathers*s tried*s Me*i by*s testing*s Me,*i And*ln saw*s My*s works*s for*s forty*s years.*s
Therefore*sln I was*s angry*s with*s this*s generation,*s And*ln said,*s ‘They*s always*s go*s astray*s in*s their*s heart,*s And*ln they*s did*s not*s know*s My*s ways’;*s
As*ln I swore*s in*s My*s wrath,*s ‘They*sln shall*s not*s enter*s My*s rest*s .’ ”
The Peril of Unbelief
Take*p care, brethren, that there not be in any one of you an evil, unbelieving heart that falls away from the living God.
But encourage one another day after day, as long as it is still*i called “Today,” so that none of you will be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.
For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our assurance firm until the end,
while it is said, “Today*spn if*s you*s hear*s His*s voice,*s Do*sln not*s harden*s your*s hearts,*s as*s when*s they*s provoked*s Me.”*s
For*p who provoked Him*i when they had heard? Indeed, did not all those who came out of Egypt led*i by Moses?
And with whom was He angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?
And to whom did He swear that they would not enter His rest, but to those who were disobedient?
So*i we see that they were not able to enter because of unbelief.
